BCB330Y1-Y-20229.courseTitle: Special Project in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology
BCB330Y1-Y-20229.courseDescription: An opportunity for specialized individual research in bioinformatics and computational biology by arrangement with a supervisor. Approval of the application by the BCB coordinator is required. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
BCB330Y1-Y-20229.prerequisite: Permission of the course coordinator (application required). Significant background in both life science and computer science courses is required.
BCB330Y1-Y-20229.webTimetableInstructions: Students are expected to find their own supervisor from the list of potential BCB supervisors. For more information, please visit: https://bcb.csb.utoronto.ca/. To enrol in this course, please send an email with your student ID along with the completed registration form (available on the BCB website) to undergrad.csb@utoronto.ca.
BCB330Y1-Y-20229.deliveryInstructions: The delivery of independent research courses is unique to each project. The project is typically designed by the supervisor with input from the student. Students are responsible for contacting potential supervisors. Students will work primarily on their own, but are required to meet with their supervisors at mutually convenient times throughout the term.

BCB410H1-F-20229.courseDescription: Practical introduction to concepts, standards and tools for the implementation of strategies in bioinformatics and computational biology. Student led discussions plus a strong component of hands-on exercises.
BCB410H1-F-20229.prerequisite: BCH311H1/CSB349H1/MGY311Y1; (CSC324H1/CSC373H1/CSC375H1). Students who do not have the stated prerequisites are encouraged to contact the course coordinator.

BCB420H1-S-20229.courseDescription: Current approaches to using the computer for analyzing and modeling biology as integrated molecular systems. Lectures plus hands-on practical exercises. The course extends and complements an introductory Bioinformatics course, such as BCH441H1.
BCB420H1-S-20229.prerequisite: BCH441H1/CSB472H1 or permission of the course coordinator

BCB430Y1-Y-20229.courseTitle: Advanced Special Project in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology
BCB430Y1-Y-20229.courseDescription: An opportunity for advanced specialized individual research in bioinformatics and computational biology by arrangement with a supervisor. Approval of the application by the BCB coordinator is required. BCB330Y1 is a recommended preparation for this course however students should not normally conduct their project in the same laboratory or continue their previous project. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
BCB430Y1-Y-20229.prerequisite: Permission of the course coordinator (application required). Significant background in both life science and computer science courses is required.
BCB430Y1-Y-20229.webTimetableInstructions: Students are expected to find their own supervisor from the list of potential BCB supervisors. For more information, please visit: https://bcb.csb.utoronto.ca/. To enrol in this course, please send an email with your student ID along with the completed registration form (available on the BCB website) to undergrad.csb@utoronto.ca.
BCB430Y1-Y-20229.deliveryInstructions: The delivery of independent research courses is unique to each project. The project is typically designed by the supervisor with input from the student. Students are responsible for contacting possible supervisors. Students will work primarily on their own, but are required to meet with their supervisors at mutually convenient times throughout the term.
